author: poojaranjan
content:
**EIPIP Meeting 85**
Date and Time: July 12, 2023 at 14:00 UTC
https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/EIPIP/issues/248

author: gcolvin
content: Thanks for your time and patience this morning.  It strikes me now that the Core Devs really are a working group, and that in the IETF process official WGs are given a lot of responsibility for their own process and quality standards.  In some ways this is where we started -- Core EIPs had only three statuses: Draft, Final, and Withdrawn. The Core Devs could move proposals through their own workflow as they pleased -- all we asked is that in the end we had a Final EIP that described what actually went onto the mainnet.

author: gcolvin
content: Philosophically, my issue is this.  I think we can all see the divergence and feel the tension in the community.  It seems to me that most of us want to ease the tension by supporting the divergence of the communities. For myself, that is exactly what I do not want to happen.

author: gcolvin
content: It is at the core of my efforts that we are all of us Ethereum Magicians.

author: _shemnon
content: Other than personal preference what argument is there for keeping a unified process?
